intro: Tournefortia sagrana, commonly known as the coastal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture. Tournefortia sagrana is adapted to salt spray and can thrive in brackish or saline environments.
